title: Introduction
text:
ggplot(gapminder) +
  geom_point(aes(x = gdpPercap, y = lifeExp,
                 color = continent), alpha = .25) +
  labs(x = "GDP per capita",
       y = "Life Expectancy",
       color = "Continent") +
  theme_economist()
oj <- read_csv('https://bcdanl.github.io/data/dominick_oj.csv')

Rows: 28947 Columns: 4
‚îÄ‚îÄ Column specification ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
Delimiter: ","
chr (1): brand
dbl (3): sales, price, ad

‚Ñπ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
‚Ñπ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

nvars <- format(round(ncol(oj), 0), 
                nsmall=0, 
                big.mark=",") 
nobs <- format(round(nrow(oj), 0), 
                nsmall=0, 
                big.mark=",")
The number of variables is 4; the number of observations is 28,947.
Roses are red
violets are blue.

title: Introduction
text:
Data Summary

Summary statistics (Use skimr::skim())

title: Introduction
text:
Data Visualization

oj %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = log(sales), 
             y = log(price),
             color = brand)) +
  geom_point(alpha = .1) +
  geom_smooth(method = lm, se = F) +
  facet_wrap(.~ad) +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(legend.position = 'top')

`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'

title: Introduction
text:
Data Transformation

ob_sum1 <- oj %>% 
  group_by(brand, ad) %>% 
  summarise(sales_tot = sum(sales, na.rm = T),
            price_mean = round(mean(price, na.rm = T), 2))

`summarise()` has grouped output by 'brand'. You can override using the
`.groups` argument.

title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn‚Äôt specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: danl-200-cw-10
text:
Quarto
Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.

title: danl-200-cw-10
text:
Running Code
When you click the Render button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

1 + 1

[1] 2


You can add options to executable code like this


[1] 4


The echo: false option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

title: DANL Project
section: 2.2 MPG and a Type of Cars
text:
2.2 MPG and a Type of Cars
The following boxplot shows how the distribution of highway MPG (hwy) varies by a type of cars (class) üöô üöö üöê.

ggplot(data = mpg) +
  geom_boxplot(aes(x = class, y = hwy, fill = class),
               show.legend = F) +
  labs(x = "Class", y = "Highway\nMPG")
